title: Prayers held for US church victims
desc: Prayers are held in South Carolina and across the US after the killing of nine people at an African-American church in Charleston.

title: Emergency summit called over Greece
desc: Leaders from eurozone nations are to hold an emergency summit on Monday after the latest attempts to resolve the Greek debt crisis failed.

title: Danish opposition wins election
desc: Denmark's opposition beats the ruling coalition in the general election with an anti-immigration party becoming the second largest in parliament.

title: Brian Williams to join MSNBC
desc: US news anchor Brian Williams will not return to NBC Nightly News but will join cable news network MSNBC in an undisclosed role.

title: PM warns of 'quietly condoning' IS
desc: Prime Minister David Cameron is expected to warn of the dangers posed by those who quietly condone Islamic State militants' extremist ideology.

title: Brazil senators flee Venezuela attack
desc: A group of eight Brazilian senators on a visit to Venezuela to meet a jailed opposition leader say they had to flee after their bus was attacked.

title: Toxic alcohol kills 27 in India
desc: At least 27 people die after consuming toxic alcohol in India's western city of Mumbai local police say.

title: DNA reignites ancient skeleton row
desc: DNA tests show an ancient skeleton known as Kennewick Man is related to modern Native Americans - reigniting a debate over whether his bones should be returned to local tribes and reburied.

title: Thailand confirms first Mers case
desc: Thailand confirms its first case of Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (Mers) the deadly virus that has killed 24 people in South Korea.

title: Elephant poaching hotspots identified
desc: Most illegally poached African elephant ivory can be traced back to just two areas of Africa research shows.

title: Hijacked Malaysian oil tanker freed
desc: An oil tanker that was hijacked by pirates last week off Singapore's coast has been released the Malaysian Navy says.

title: Royals attend Waterloo commemoration
desc: Royal Family members attend a St Paul's Cathedral service commemorating the 200th anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo.

title: VIDEO: 'It's in our power to act on gun crime'
desc: US President Barack Obama has responded to a shooting at a church in Charleston. saying the US should recognise that this type of mass violence does not happen in other advanced countries'.'

title: VIDEO: On the tense India-Myanmar border
desc: India claims a cross-border raid against rebels in Myanmar last week was a big success but the lack of detail about the operation has fuelled speculation.

title: VIDEO: Is Iran paying Afghan mercenaries?
desc: It is thought hundreds of unemployed men from Afghanistan supported by the Iranian government have taken up arms alongside President Assad's forces in Syria.

title: VIDEO: Who are Battle of Waterloo re-enactors?
desc: The BBC's Robert Hall reports from a re-enactment camp as rehearsals take place to fight key moments of the Battle of Waterloo.

title: VIDEO: 'Carpet of crabs' covers US beaches
desc: Hundreds of thousands of tiny crabs have been washing up on Southern California's beaches after warm ocean currents carried them closer to the shoreline than usual.

title: VIDEO: Winehouse documentary angers family
desc: A documentary about the life of the late award-winning singer Amy Winehouse has its UK premiere at the Edinburgh International Film Festival.

title: VIDEO: Swapping London for northern Australia
desc: Aaron Snell is a 29-year-old Londoner who was lured to the northern Australian city of Darwin in search of work and adventure.

title: VIDEO: House washed away in China floods
desc: Chinese TV footage shows houses washed away and people rescued after torrential rainfall caused flooding in China's Hubei and Jiangsu province.

title: Have Israel-US relations reached a new low?
desc: These are turbulent times for the relationship between Israel and its closest ally says Jonathan Marcus.

title: Obama's 'hopeless' push for gun control
desc: Barack Obama says the nation will have to address gun control at some point but Republicans counter that more government regulation can't stop attacks like the one in Charleston.

title: Greece prepares for battle amid angry rhetoric
desc: Barbs fly as battle of nerves over Greece intensifies

title: The women whom science forgot
desc: Many female scientists in the past were not given credit for their achievements - here are just a few of them.

title: The man who can't stop making money
desc: This week-end hundreds of thousands of small investors will be saluting Neil Woodford whose fund has provided an 18% return in its first year

title: VIDEO: What's behind US hate crimes?
desc: According to the most recent FBI data available over 7000 people in the US were victims of hate crimes in 2013. The BBC takes a look at what the numbers say about who is committing these crimes and why.

title: Nigerian finds suitor via radio appeal
desc: A woman who went on radio to appeal for a husband in the northern Nigerian city of Kano has found a suitor a journalist tells the BBC.

title: Most kangaroos are 'left-handed'
desc: Scientists report that wild kangaroos tend to favour their left hands in common tasks - the first example of non-human species-wide handedness.

title: Fitbit shares soar on market debut
desc: Shares in the wearable technology maker Fitbit soar on its first day of trading on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Nasdaq index closes at record high
desc: The tech-heavy Nasdaq index closed at a record high on Thursday with the Dow Jones and the S&P also closing sharply higher.

title: Huge fine for AT&T over speed brakes
desc: US telecoms company AT&T faces a $100m (£63m) fine for slowing down the internet speeds of millions of customers on unlimited data plans without informing them.

title: Battery-swap electric scooter debuts
desc: An electric scooter with swappable batteries is to go on sale in Taiwan priced $4140 (£2600).

title: Critics savage Fifty Shades rewrite
desc: Critics savage EL James's rewrite of her erotic bestseller Fifty Shades of Grey with one accusing it of rapturous self-regard.

title: Tommy Chong treated for cancer
desc: Tommy Chong - one half of the 1970s comedy duo Cheech and Chong - reveals he has rectal cancer.

title: Pope makes plea to save the planet
desc: Pope Francis has blamed human selfishness for global warming in his long-awaited encyclical calling for action on climate change.

title: Happy memories 'perk up' stressed mice
desc: Neuroscientists find that artificially stimulating a positive memory can cause mice to snap out of depression-like behaviour.

title: New anti-malaria compound discovered
desc: Scientists at Dundee University develop an exciting new single-dose malaria drug to combat drug-resistant parasites.

title: Blood chemical predicts brain decline
desc: Scientists discover a chemical in blood that indicates whether people will have declining brain function in the years to come.

title: Woods struggles to 80 at US Open
desc: Tiger Woods finishes 15 shots behind leaders Henrik Stenson and Dustin Johnson after round one of the US Open at Chambers Bay.

title: England U21 0-1 Portugal U21
desc: England fail to score for the first time in 18 matches as they lose 1-0 to Portugal in their European Under-21 Championship opener.

title: How did the Turin Shroud get its image?
desc: Some say it's Jesus Christ's burial wrapping others say it's a medieval fake. Either way how does the Turin Shroud come to bear a man's image?

title: The great Moldovan bank robbery
desc: It's a mystery that's thrown Europe's poorest nation into deep crisis - $1bn has vanished from three of Moldova's leading banks much of it passing through UK companies.

title: Prince has 'secret' show for Obamas
desc: White House officials will not say whether pop star Prince performed at a weekend party at the executive residence despite guests posting about it on social media.

title: Mayor's cleaning protest over litter
desc: Turkish mayor wants people to see how much mess they make.

title: Liberia's Bility to make Fifa bid
desc: The head of the Liberia Football Association says he wants to replace Sepp Blatter as the president of Fifa.

title: VIDEO: Monks fight 'threat' to Myanmar pagoda
desc: Monks in Myanmar are fighting plans for development of land close to the Schwedagon Pagoda one of the country's most famous Buddhist landmarks.

title: EU acts against German road charge
desc: Germany postpones a controversial road toll scheme as the European Commission takes legal action against it.

title: Mexican police remove gang cameras
desc: Police in the Mexican border city of Reynosa dismantle dozens of surveillance cameras set up by a gang to monitor the security forces.

title: World's displaced 'hits record high'
desc: The number of people displaced by war conflict or persecution reached a record high of nearly 60 million around the world in 2014 a UN report says.

title: US lawmakers approve trade plan
desc: The House of Representatives has approved a controversial trade bill backed by President Obama just a week after Democrats voted it down.

title: 'New deal' if GPs open seven days
desc: The government is promising a new deal for GPs - if they sign up to seven-day opening.

title: Many over-65s 'shun public transport'
desc: The public transport system is failing the oldest and most vulnerable in society in England with many never using it a report says.

title: Dreamland set to open to revellers
desc: A funfair that formed the centrepiece of seaside days out for generations of day-trippers to Kent is reopening after an £18m restoration.

title: Fake online reviews prompt probe
desc: Businesses are ambushing rivals with fake reviews and customers are reportedly using the threat of online criticism to win discounts research finds.

title: In pictures: Unseen Waterloo
desc: Sam Faulkner's portraits commemorate the Battle’s bicentenary

title: In pictures: Unusual sites awarded listed status
desc: A selection of unusual sites added to the National Heritage List for England in the past year.

title: Indian youth leap into skateboarding
desc: The popularity of skateboarding in India

title: Syrian refugees share 'safe space'
desc: Young Syrian refugees in Lebanon express their feelings through photography

title: Dakar fashion week shows Senegal style
desc: A model's journey through Dakar fashion week

title: Paris Air Show: From hot air to heavy metal
desc: Looking back at the history of the show in pictures

title: In pictures: India prepares for Yoga Day
desc: Indians limber up for International Yoga Day

title: Week in pictures: 6-12 June 2015
desc: A selection of the best news photographs from around the world

desc: New insight into mass sinking of WW1 ships

title: Why is the yoga day stressing India?
desc: Why is India in a twist over yoga day?

desc: Mystery over India's anti-rebel raid in Myanmar

desc: What's the next Game of Thrones book to be called?

desc: The jobless Afghans who say Iran pays them to fight in Syria
